info.title: Deribit API - Wallet
info.description: Deribit API specification for Wallet endpoints

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Number of requested items, default - `10`, maximum - `1000`

get.description: Retrieve the latest users deposits **ðŸ“– Related Support Article:** [Deposits](https://support.deribit.com/hc/en-us/articles/25944616988957-Deposits)

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Address in currency format, it must be in address book

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Amount of funds to be withdrawn

parameters.name: priority
parameters.description: Withdrawal priority, optional for BTC, default: `high`

get.description: Creates a new withdrawal request **ðŸ“– Related Support Article:** [Withdrawals](https://support.deribit.com/hc/en-us/articles/25944635205021-Withdrawals)

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Number of requested items, default - `10`, maximum - `1000`

get.description: Retrieves address book of given type

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: Label of the address book entry

parameters.name: beneficiary_vasp_website
parameters.description: Website of the beneficiary VASP. Required if the address book entry is associated with a VASP that is not included in the list of known VASPs

parameters.name: beneficiary_first_name
parameters.description: First name of beneficiary (if beneficiary is a person)

parameters.name: beneficiary_last_name
parameters.description: First name of beneficiary (if beneficiary is a person)

parameters.name: beneficiary_company_name
parameters.description: Beneficiary company name (if beneficiary is a company)

parameters.name: agreed
parameters.description: Indicates that the user agreed to shared provided information with 3rd parties

parameters.name: personal
parameters.description: The user confirms that he provided address belongs to him and he has access to it via an un-hosted wallet software

parameters.name: extra_currencies
parameters.description: The user can pass a list of currencies to add the address for. It is currently available ONLY for ERC20 currencies. Without passing this paramater for an ERC20 currency, the address will be added to ALL of the ERC20 currencies.

get.description: Adds new entry to address book of given type

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Address in currency format, it must be in address book

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Address in currency format, it must be in address book

parameters.name: beneficiary_vasp_website
parameters.description: Website of the beneficiary VASP. Required if the address book entry is associated with a VASP that is not included in the list of known VASPs

parameters.name: beneficiary_first_name
parameters.description: First name of beneficiary (if beneficiary is a person)

parameters.name: beneficiary_last_name
parameters.description: First name of beneficiary (if beneficiary is a person)

parameters.name: beneficiary_company_name
parameters.description: Beneficiary company name (if beneficiary is a company)

parameters.name: agreed
parameters.description: Indicates that the user agreed to shared provided information with 3rd parties

parameters.name: personal
parameters.description: The user confirms that he provided address belongs to him and he has access to it via an un-hosted wallet software

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: Label of the address book entry

parameters.description: Indicates if the address belongs to an unhosted wallet

parameters.name: beneficiary_vasp_website
parameters.description: Website of the beneficiary VASP. Required if the address book entry is associated with a VASP that is not included in the list of known VASPs

parameters.name: beneficiary_first_name
parameters.description: First name of beneficiary (if beneficiary is a person)

parameters.name: beneficiary_last_name
parameters.description: First name of beneficiary (if beneficiary is a person)

parameters.name: beneficiary_company_name

parameters.description: Website of the beneficiary VASP. Required if the address book entry is associated with a VASP that is not included in the list of known VASPs

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return

get.description: Lists address beneficiaries with optional filtering and pagination

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Amount of funds to be transferred

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: Id of destination subaccount. Can be found in `My Account >> Subaccounts` tab

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Amount of funds to be transferred

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: Id of destination subaccount. Can be found in `My Account >> Subaccounts` tab

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Id of the source (sub)account. Can be found in `My Account >> Subaccounts` tab. By default, it is the Id of the account which made the request. However, if a different "source" is specified, the user must possess the mainaccount scope, and only other subaccounts can be designated as the source.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Amount of funds to be transferred

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: Destination wallet's address taken from address book

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Number of requested items, default - `10`, maximum - `1000`

get.description: Returns reward eligibility status and APR data for all supported currencies. **ðŸ“– Related Support Article:** [Yield reward-bearing coins](https://support.deribit.com/hc/en-us/articles/26525792475677-Yield-reward-bearing-coins)

parameters.description: Information about the originator of the deposit
parameters.name: originator

address_label.description: Label of the address book entry

beneficiary_first_name.description: First name of the beneficiary (if beneficiary is a person)

beneficiary_company_name.description: Company name of the beneficiary (if beneficiary is a company)

agree_to_share_with_3rd_party.description: Indicates that the user agreed to shared provided information with 3rd parties

timestamp.description: The timestamp (milliseconds since the Unix epoch)

personal_wallet.description: The user confirms that he provided address belongs to him and he has access to it via an un-hosted wallet software

extra_currencies.description: The user can pass a list of currencies to add the address for. It is currently available ONLY for ERC20 currencies. Without passing this paramater for an ERC20 currency, the address will be added to ALL of the ERC20 currencies.

beneficiary_last_name.description: Last name of the beneficiary (if beneficiary is a person)

id.description: The id that was sent in the request
The id that was sent in the request
The id that was sent in the request
The id that was sent in the request

eligibility_status.description: - `eligible`: User can get reward for specific currency for all its equity - `partially_eligible`: User can get reward for specific currency, but custody balance is excluded - `non_eligible`: User can not get reward for specific currency

apr_sma7.description: Simple Moving Average (SMA) of the last 7 days of rewards for the currency

id.description: The id that was sent in the request
The id that was sent in the request
The id that was sent in the request

result.description: Object if address is created, null otherwise

id.description: The id that was sent in the request
The id that was sent in the request
The id that was sent in the request
The id that was sent in the request
The id that was sent in the request
The id that was sent in the request
The id that was sent in the request
The id that was sent in the request

confirmed_timestamp.description: The timestamp (milliseconds since the Unix epoch) of withdrawal confirmation, `null` when not confirmed

currency_address.description: Address in proper format for currency

address_info_required.description: Signalises that addition information regarding the beneficiary of the address is required

deposit_state.description: Deposit state. Allowed values: - `pending`: deposit detected on blockchain/system, compliance not yet finished - `completed`: compliance check finished successfully - `rejected`: deposit failed compliance and must be handled manually - `replaced`: deposit transaction was replaced on the blockchain and should have a new transaction hash

waiting_timestamp.description: Timestamp when the address will be ready

currency_amount.description: Amount of funds in given currency

clearance_state.description: Clearance state indicating the current status of the transaction clearance process. Allowed values: - `in_progress`: clearance process is in progress - `pending_admin_decision`: transaction is under manual review by Deribit admin - `pending_user_input`: user should provide additional information regarding the transaction - `success`: clearance process completed successfully - `failed`: clearance process failed, transaction is rejected - `cancelled`: transaction is cancelled (currently used only for withdrawals, meaning the withdrawal is cancelled) - `refund_initiated`: clearance process failed, transaction refund is initiated, funds are removed from Deribit balance (valid for deposits only) - `refunded`: clearance process failed, deposit amount is refunded back to the client (valid for deposits only)

transfer_other_side.description: For transfer from/to subaccount returns this subaccount name, for transfer to other account returns address, for transfer from other account returns that accounts username.

requires_confirmation_change.description: If email confirmation change is in progress

unhosted_wallet.description: Indicates if the address belongs to an unhosted wallet

requires_confirmation.description: If address requires email confirmation for withdrawals

transfer_state.description: Transfer state, allowed values : `prepared`, `confirmed`, `cancelled`, `waiting_for_admin`, `insufficient_funds`, `withdrawal_limit` otherwise rejection reason

currency_transaction_id.description: Transaction id in proper format for currency, `null` if id is not available

ErrorResponse.description: Generic error response for broken references

id.description: The id that was sent in the request

result.description: Result of method execution. `ok` in case of success
